Password.description: Password to use when authenticating to the source. Terraform cannot perform drift detection of this configuration.

Revision.description: For sources that are version-aware, the revision to use.

SshKey.description: SSH key to use when authenticating to the source. Terraform cannot perform drift detection of this configuration.

Type.description: The type of source to use. For example, "archive".

Url.description: The URL where the app resource can be found.

Username.description: Username to use when authenticating to the source.

Secure.description: Set visibility of the variable value to `true` or `false`.

Certificate.description: The contents of the certificate's domain.crt file.

Chain.description: Can be used to specify an intermediate certificate authority key or client authentication.

PrivateKey.description: The private key; the contents of the certificate's domain.key file.

tfcfnid.description: Internal identifier for tracking resource changes. Do not use.

AutoBundleOnDeploy.description: Run bundle install when deploying for application of type `rails`.

AwsFlowRubySettings.description: Specify activity and workflow workers for your app using the aws-flow gem.

DataSourceType.description: The data source's type one of `AutoSelectOpsworksMysqlInstance`, `OpsworksMysqlInstance`, or `RdsDbInstance`.

DocumentRoot.description: Subfolder for the document root for application of type `rails`.

Domains.description: A list of virtual host alias.

EnableSsl.description: Whether to enable SSL for the app. This must be set in order to let `ssl_configuration.private_key`, `ssl_configuration.certificate` and `ssl_configuration.chain` take effect.

Name.description: A human-readable name for the application.

RailsEnv.description: The name of the Rails environment for application of type `rails`.

ShortName.description: A short, machine-readable name for the application. This can only be defined on resource creation and ignored on resource update.

StackId.description: The id of the stack the application will belong to.

Type.description: Opsworks application type. One of `aws-flow-ruby`, `java`, `rails`, `php`, `nodejs`, `static` or `other`.
